sentences.en: Everyone dislikes him because he is always flaunting his seniority.
sentences.cn: 他总喜欢称大,所以大家都很讨厌他.

sentences.en: He felt that two years'seniority gave him the right to advise his brother.
sentences.cn: 他觉得年长两岁使他有权劝告他的弟弟.

sentences.en: He has said he will fire editorial employees without regard to seniority.
sentences.cn: 他说过不管资历如何，任何编辑人员他都有可能解雇。

sentences.en: I had 15 years seniority , and they couldn’t fire me.
sentences.cn: 我在这里有15年的资历，他们不可以解雇我。

sentences.en: I sacrificed two years'seniority by taking the overseas posting.
sentences.cn: 由于去国外任职,我牺牲了两年的资历.

sentences.en: In seniority I was four or five years older than Roosevelt or Stalin.
sentences.cn: 按照年令,我又比罗斯福或斯大林年长四、五岁.

sentences.en: Influenced by old ideas, some units assign posts according to seniority.
sentences.cn: 由于受旧观念的影响, 有些单位分配工作按资排辈.

sentences.en: It's less about seniority and teaching, and more about sharing and development.
sentences.cn: 资历和教授都很少, 更多的是分享和开发.

sentences.en: Only Ingram had the seniority, and knew Celia well enough, to laugh aloud.
sentences.cn: 只有英格拉姆放声笑了出来,他资历最老, 并深知西莉亚的为人.

sentences.en: Ought promotion to go by seniority or by abilities?
sentences.cn: 晋级应以年资为准,还是以能力为准?

sentences.en: Presuming on his seniority , he always imposes his ideas on [ upon ] others.
sentences.cn: 他总是 倚老卖老,把他的想法强加于人.

sentences.en: Promotion in the job was by seniority.
sentences.cn: 这种工作得按资历晋升.

sentences.en: Some firms list officers first, in order of seniority.
sentences.cn: 有些公司则是按照资历顺序,先列高级官员.

sentences.en: The officers were listed in order of seniority.
sentences.cn: 官员列名以职位高低为序.

sentences.en: These executives are on loan, retaining their seniority and pension rights in the parent company.
sentences.cn: 这些人员都是临时性的, 他们在母公司中仍然保留原职原薪以及原有的住宅.

words.tran_cn: 高级的；年长的；地位较高的；年资较深的，资格较老的
上司；较年长者；毕业班学生
长辈；老资格；前任者的特权

trans.tran_cn: 年长，职位高，年资， 资历
trans.tran_en: if you have seniority in a company or organization, you have worked there a long time and have some official advantages
